transportAdvice: The Hague has an extensive tram and bus network that connects most tourist areas efficiently, and the compact city centre is very walkable. Taxis are readily available, and cycling is a popular and practical option given the flat terrain and well-developed bike infrastructure.

weather.description: Cold and grey with frequent rain and occasional frost; pack warm, waterproof layers.
Still cold and damp with overcast skies, though daylight hours begin to slowly increase.
Early spring brings milder temperatures but changeable weather; rain showers remain common.
Pleasantly mild with occasional sunny spells; tulip season makes this a popular time to visit.
Warm and increasingly sunny with blooming parks; one of the more enjoyable months to explore the city.
Warm early summer weather with long daylight hours; occasional showers but generally pleasant.
The warmest month with long days; beach visits to nearby Scheveningen are popular despite occasional rain.
Warm and summery with good beach weather, though afternoon showers can occur.
Early autumn brings cooler evenings but still comfortable daytime temperatures and fewer crowds.
Noticeably cooler and wetter as autumn sets in; a jacket and umbrella are essential.
Grey and rainy with short days; indoor attractions and cosy cafes come into their own.
Cold and damp with festive Christmas markets adding seasonal charm to the city centre.
